Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: These fragments of papyrus, which have been found at Oxyrhynchus (P.Oxy. VI 856) and which date from the 3rd century of our time, contain a commentary on the "Archarniens " of Aristophanes. This comedy from the famous writer of Athens (445-385 B.C.) is a plea to terminate the war against Sparta and for a peace which all the Athenian population had long hoped for.
